data.title: 3.10 Install fmod for new AudioEngine on Linux with install-deps-linux.
data.body:
**Link** - http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/error-while-building-for-linux-libfmod-so-6/26553/4 

**Description** - When you have a fresh download of cocos2d-x 3.10 and you do all the normal step (ex. `./download-deps.sh` and `./install-deps-linux.sh`) the build will still crash with this error:

`/bin/debug/linux/MyGame: error while loading shared libraries: libfmod.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`

The way to fix this is to copy the `libfmod.so` and `libfmodL.so` to `/usr/local/lib/` and the `fmod.h` files to `/usr/local/include/`. I was wondering if we could add this to the `install-deps-linux.sh` script.

The commands:
`sudo cp <*COCOS FOLDER LOCATION*>/external/linux-specific/fmod/prebuilt/64-bit/libfmod.so /usr/local/lib/`

`sudo cp  <*COCOS FOLDER LOCATION*>/external/linux-specific/fmod/prebuilt/64-bit/libfmodL.so /usr/local/lib/`

`sudo cp <*COCOS FOLDER LOCATION*>/external/linux-specific/fmod/include/*.h /usr/local/include/`

Then Run the script  install-deps-linux again

data.title: RenderTexture + Stencil fails on Tegra devices (Nexus 7)
Optimize the OpenGL Log Functions in CCGLProgram.cpp
Same 'else if' conditions in translateChildProperty() function
Same statements in 'if' block in fillConstraintRowMultiBodyMultiBody() function
Wrong conditional expression in spAtlas_create()
data.body:
In cocos2d-x-3.10\cocos\editor-support\spine\Atlas.c, 226
in function spAtlas_create() there is a code:

``` cpp
page->vWrap = *str.begin == 'x' ? SP_ATLAS_CLAMPTOEDGE : (*str.begin == 'y' ? SP_ATLAS_REPEAT : SP_ATLAS_REPEAT);
```

Second ?: clause will always return SP_ATLAS_REPEAT, so it could be a bug or redudant verification

data.title: Incorrect 'if' condition in js_cocos2dx_ccmat4TransformVector()
Fixed flipped polygon sprite
data.body: There was an error: if you change the polygon information that previously defined flipX(or Y) not taken into sprite. Changes polygon information derived from the change of the frame in the animation.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
merge from cocos2dx v3.10
fix #14909 issue
data.body:
This PR adds autoscroll finish event to ui::ScrollView , and changes PageView::addEventListener parameter type from PageView::EventType to ScrollView::EventType. 

PageView event is not invoked at auto scroll fishing since v3.10. Because PageView inherited ScrollView.

So, I added autoscroll finish event ot ui::ScrollView, added ScreenView::addEventListener to PageView class.

please review this PR.

Whats not done

- binding system i am not experience enough to make bindings.

data.title: ControlSwitch::create(Sprite *maskSprite, Sprite * onSprite, Sprite * offSprite, Sprite * thumbSprite) crashes
data.body:
ControlSwitch::create(Sprite _maskSprite, Sprite \* onSprite, Sprite \* offSprite, Sprite \* thumbSprite) crashe. It calls initWithMaskSprite(maskSprite, onSprite, offSprite, thumbSprite, nullptr, nullptr) and eventually crashes when calling clipper->addChild(onLabel) and clipper->addChild(offLabel) in ControlSwitchSprite::initWithMaskSprite(
    Sprite *maskSprite, 
    Sprite *onSprite, 
    Sprite *offSprite,
    Sprite *thumbSprite,
    Label_ onLabel, 
    Label\* offLabel)
because onLabel and OffLabel is nullptr.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
Export WICImageLoader form DLL
data.body:
We have a remote image loader that base64 encodes WICPixelFormat buffers and sends them to our backend.  We found it useful to DLL export WICImageLoader so that we didn't have to use a different library and/or roll our own.

@stammen

data.title: Josh/dll export wicimageloader
data.body: We have a remote image loader that base64 encodes WICPixelFormat buffers and sends them to our backend.  We found it useful to DLL export WICImageLoader so that we didn't have to use a different library and/or roll our own.

data.title: Josh/export wic image loader
data.body: Turns out we needed this in our app.  We have a remote image loader that extends WicImageLoader.

data.title: Mark equals() functions as const
data.body:
I think several `equals()` functions are effectively const methods, but they arent marked `const`.
This PR adds `const` keyword to them.

data.title: Cocos compile script ignores missing hellocpp/main.cpp in Android.mk and this results in seg fault when running app
data.body:
Error display needs to happen when hellocpp/main.cpp is not added to Android.mk LOCAL_SRC_FILES. (located in proj.android/jni or proj.android-studio/app/jni) See below:

LOCAL_SRC_FILES := hellocpp/main.cpp \
../../../Classes/AppDelegate.cpp \
../../../Classes/HelloWorldScene.cpp \

This results in correct behavior with the default cpp template. However if the first file is omitted, like so:
LOCAL_SRC_FILES :=  ../../../Classes/AppDelegate.cpp \
../../../Classes/HelloWorldScene.cpp \

, then there is no error message displayed when either I compiled for android or android studio with the cocos command line tool. I used ndk r10e, build tools 23.0.2, api 18, jdk 7, win 8.1 x64.

This is the error message I got over and over in Android Studio because of the absence of hellocpp/main.cpp.

01-21 14:19:16.494 13993-13993/? D/dalvikvm: Late-enabling CheckJNI
01-21 14:19:18.099 13993-13993/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 W/ActivityThread: Application org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 is waiting for the debugger on port 8100...
01-21 14:19:18.119 13993-13999/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 I/dalvikvm: Debugger is active
01-21 14:19:18.589 13993-13993/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 D/dalvikvm: Trying to load lib /data/app-lib/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2-1/libcocos2dcpp.so 0x42421b38
01-21 14:19:18.959 13993-13993/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 D/dalvikvm: Added shared lib /data/app-lib/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2-1/libcocos2dcpp.so 0x42421b38
01-21 14:19:18.959 13993-13993/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 D/JniHelper: JniHelper::setJavaVM(0x419ade20), pthread_self() = 1075441660
**01-21 14:19:18.959 13993-13993/org.cocos2dx.TestGame2 A/libc: Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000000 (code=1), thread 13993 (os2dx.TestGame2)**

I reproduced this error many times over and over (sadly) with fresh builds as well.
